pr_title: ci: Build release package with correct telemetry key

timeline.message:
ci: Build release package with correct telemetry key

The telemetry key was injected before the package build.
And wiped out after to not be present in repo.

Signed-off-by: Anton Grigorev <anton.grigorev@broadcom.com>

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need to skip tests on release?
timeline.author: temanbrcom
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -15,7 +15,8 @@ jobs:
       with:
         java-version: 11
     - name: Build with Maven
-      run: cd server; mvn package -DskipTests --no-transfer-progress
+      working-directory: server
+      run: mvn package -DskipTests --no-transfer-progress

replies.bodyText: They fail, and I don't know why. I can check the current state.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Would the env variable $THE_KEY be visible in log here? I guess only secrets are obfuscated
timeline.author: filipkroupa
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,7 +1,15 @@
 {
   "hooks": {
-    "before:init": ["git config user.email \"dont@write.here\"", "git config user.name \"Caring bot\""],
-    "after:bump": "git add ../../CHANGELOG.md; npx vsce package"
+    "before:init": [
+      "git config user.email \"dont@write.here\"",
+      "git config user.name \"Caring bot\""
+    ],
+    "after:bump": [
+      "git add ../../CHANGELOG.md",
+      "echo $THE_KEY > resources/TELEMETRY_KEY",

replies.bodyText:
The value is not present in logs.
You can see an example here: https://github.com/grianbrcom/che-che4z-lsp-for-cobol/runs/1442316084?check_suite_focus=true in "Make a release" section.
replies.author: grianbrcom
